title: From the Top Down: Does Corruption Affect Performance?. (arXiv:2310.20028v1 [q-fin.GN])
abstract: Corruption, fraud, and unethical activities have emerged as significant obstacles to global economic, political, and social progress. Although many empirical studies have focused on country-level corruption metrics, this study is the first to utilize a substantial international dataset to assess the effects of illicit and unethical managerial practices on firm performance. Employing cross-sectional data, this research examines the influence of corruption on corporate outcomes. Our definition of corruption evaluates the degree to which managers engage in mismanagement, misconduct, or corrupt activities. The repercussions for corporate governance, especially concerning the process of appointing managers, are both crucial and strategic.

translated_title: 自上而下：腐败是否影响绩效？
translated_abstract: 腐败、欺诈和不道德行为已成为全球经济、政治和社会进步的重要障碍。虽然许多经验性研究关注国家层面的腐败指标，但这项研究是第一个利用大规模国际数据集评估非法和不道德的管理实践对企业绩效的影响。通过横截面数据，本研究考察了腐败对企业结果的影响。我们对腐败的定义评估了管理人员参与不善管理、不当行为或腐败活动的程度。对企业治理的影响，尤其是关于任命管理人员的过程，既关键又战略性。
tldr: 该研究利用大规模国际数据集，评估了非法和不道德的管理实践对企业绩效的影响，并考察了腐败对企业结果的影响。
en_tdlr: This study utilizes a substantial international dataset to assess the effects of illicit and unethical managerial practices on firm performance, and examines the influence of corruption on corporate outcomes.
